required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Radiesse® Dermal Filler for Hand Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 4, Evaluation of Radiesse® Dermal Filler for Hand Treatment

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety and effectiveness of Radiesse® Injectable Dermal Filler for hand treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective, randomized, masked, controlled study to investigate the effectiveness of Radiesse® Dermal Filler for hand treatment, comprised of a 3-month main study followed by an open-label extension (OLEX) study through 12 months. At 3 months, untreated controls received Radiesse Dermal Filler for hand treatment and were followed for the remainder of the study. All study subjects were eligible for retreatment 6 months after initial treatment, and all subjects were followed through 12 months from study enrollment in the OLEX.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change on Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS), by Hand
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of Radiesse for hand treatment as measured by a mean change on the 5-point Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS) between baseline and 3 months, by hand, among treated subjects and untreated controls. A measure of successful or improved treatment effect is demonstrated by a decrease in MHGS score. MHGS categories are as follows: 0 = no loss of fatty tissue; 1 = mild loss of fatty tissue; slight visibility of veins; 3 = moderate loss of fatty tissue; mild visibility of veins and tendons; 4 = severe loss of fatty tissue; moderate visibility of veins and tendons; and 5 = very severe loss of fatty tissue; marked visibility of veins and tendons.

primary_outcome.measure: ≥ 1-point Change on the 5-point Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS), by Hand
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of Radiesse for hand treatment as measured by a ≥ 1-point change on the 5-point Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS) between baseline and 3 months, by hand, among treated subjects and untreated controls. A measure of successful or improved treatment effect is demonstrated by a decrease in MHGS score. MHGS categories are as follows: 0 = no loss of fatty tissue; 1 = mild loss of fatty tissue; slight visibility of veins; 3 = moderate loss of fatty tissue; mild visibility of veins and tendons; 4 = severe loss of fatty tissue; moderate visibility of veins and tendons; and 5 = very severe loss of fatty tissue; marked visibility of veins and tendons.

primary_outcome.measure: ≥ 1-point Change on the 5-point Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS), by Subject
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of Radiesse for hand treatment as measured by a ≥ 1-point change on the 5-point Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS) between baseline and 3 months, by subject, among treated subjects and untreated controls. A measure of successful or improved treatment effect is demonstrated by a decrease in MHGS score. MHGS categories are as follows: 0 = no loss of fatty tissue; 1 = mild loss of fatty tissue; slight visibility of veins; 3 = moderate loss of fatty tissue; mild visibility of veins and tendons; 4 = severe loss of fatty tissue; moderate visibility of veins and tendons; and 5 = very severe loss of fatty tissue; marked visibility of veins and tendons.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change on Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS), by Hand, With Subjects Stratified by Age < 60 Years or ≥ 60 Years
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of Radiesse for hand treatment as measured by mean change on the 5-point Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS) between baseline and 3 months, by hand, among treated subjects and untreated controls, stratified by age < 60 years or ≥ 60 years. A measure of successful or improved treatment effect is demonstrated by a decrease in MHGS score. MHGS categories are as follows: 0 = no loss of fatty tissue; 1 = mild loss of fatty tissue; slight visibility of veins; 3 = moderate loss of fatty tissue; mild visibility of veins and tendons; 4 = severe loss of fatty tissue; moderate visibility of veins and tendons; and 5 = very severe loss of fatty tissue; marked visibility of veins and tendons.

secondary_outcome.measure: ≥ 1-point Change on Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS), by Hand, With Subjects Stratified by Age < 60 Years or ≥ 60 Years
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of Radiesse for hand treatment as measured by a ≥ 1-point change on the 5-point Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS) between baseline and 3 months, by hand, among treated subjects and untreated controls, stratified by age < 60 years or ≥ 60 years. A measure of successful or improved treatment effect is demonstrated by a decrease in MHGS score. MHGS categories are as follows: 0 = no loss of fatty tissue; 1 = mild loss of fatty tissue; slight visibility of veins; 3 = moderate loss of fatty tissue; mild visibility of veins and tendons; 4 = severe loss of fatty tissue; moderate visibility of veins and tendons; and 5 = very severe loss of fatty tissue; marked visibility of veins and tendons.

secondary_outcome.measure: ≥ 1-point Change on Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS), by Subject, With Subjects Stratified by Age < 60 Years or ≥ 60 Years
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of Radiesse for hand treatment as measured by a ≥ 1-point change on the 5-point Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS) between baseline and 3 months, by subject, among treated subjects and untreated controls, stratified by age < 60 years or ≥ 60 years. A measure of successful or improved treatment effect is demonstrated by a decrease in MHGS score. MHGS categories are as follows: 0 = no loss of fatty tissue; 1 = mild loss of fatty tissue; slight visibility of veins; 3 = moderate loss of fatty tissue; mild visibility of veins and tendons; 4 = severe loss of fatty tissue; moderate visibility of veins and tendons; and 5 = very severe loss of fatty tissue; marked visibility of veins and tendons.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evenness in the Left Hand Versus the Right Hand Using the Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS) Among the Original Treatment Group Only
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of Radiesse for hand treatment by comparing the evenness in the left hand versus the right hand at 3 months using the 5-point Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS) among the original treatment group only. A measure of successful or improved treatment effect is demonstrated by a decrease in MHGS score. MHGS categories are as follows: 0 = no loss of fatty tissue; 1 = mild loss of fatty tissue; slight visibility of veins; 3 = moderate loss of fatty tissue; mild visibility of veins and tendons; 4 = severe loss of fatty tissue; moderate visibility of veins and tendons; and 5 = very severe loss of fatty tissue; marked visibility of veins and tendons.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS) Ratings Among the Original Treatment Group Only
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of Radiesse for hand treatment by evaluating subject-reported, live Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS) ratings at 3 months when compared to baseline among the original treatment group only

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change on the Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS), by Hand, Among All Treated Subjects Without Retreatment
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of Radiesse for hand treatment as measured by mean change on the 5-point Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS) between baseline and 3, 6, 9, and 12 months, by hand, among all treated subjects without retreatment. A measure of successful or improved treatment effect is demonstrated by a decrease in MHGS score. MHGS categories are as follows: 0 = no loss of fatty tissue; 1 = mild loss of fatty tissue; slight visibility of veins; 3 = moderate loss of fatty tissue; mild visibility of veins and tendons; 4 = severe loss of fatty tissue; moderate visibility of veins and tendons; and 5 = very severe loss of fatty tissue; marked visibility of veins and tendons.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change on the Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS), by Hand, Among All Treated Subjects With Retreatment
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of Radiesse for hand treatment as measured by mean change on the 5-point Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS) between baseline and 3, 6, 9, and 12 months, by hand, among all treated subjects receiving retreatment. A measure of successful or improved treatment effect is demonstrated by a decrease in MHGS score. MHGS categories are as follows: 0 = no loss of fatty tissue; 1 = mild loss of fatty tissue; slight visibility of veins; 3 = moderate loss of fatty tissue; mild visibility of veins and tendons; 4 = severe loss of fatty tissue; moderate visibility of veins and tendons; and 5 = very severe loss of fatty tissue; marked visibility of veins and tendons.

secondary_outcome.measure: ≥ 1-point Change on the Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS), by Hand, Among All Treated Subjects With and Without Retreatment
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of Radiesse for hand treatment as measured by ≥ 1-point change on the 5-point Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS) between baseline and 3, 6, 9 and 12 months, by hand, among treated subjects with and without retreatment. A measure of successful or improved treatment effect is demonstrated by a decrease in MHGS score. MHGS categories are as follows: 0 = no loss of fatty tissue; 1 = mild loss of fatty tissue; slight visibility of veins; 3 = moderate loss of fatty tissue; mild visibility of veins and tendons; 4 = severe loss of fatty tissue; moderate visibility of veins and tendons; and 5 = very severe loss of fatty tissue; marked visibility of veins and tendons.

secondary_outcome.measure: ≥ 1-point Change on the Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS), by Subject, Among All Treated Subjects With and Without Retreatment
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of Radiesse for hand treatment as measured by ≥ 1-point change on the 5-point Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS) between baseline and 3, 6, 9, and 12 months, by subject, among treated subjects with and without retreatment. A measure of successful or improved treatment effect is demonstrated by a decrease in MHGS score. MHGS categories are as follows: 0 = no loss of fatty tissue; 1 = mild loss of fatty tissue; slight visibility of veins; 3 = moderate loss of fatty tissue; mild visibility of veins and tendons; 4 = severe loss of fatty tissue; moderate visibility of veins and tendons; and 5 = very severe loss of fatty tissue; marked visibility of veins and tendons.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS) Ratings, by Subject, Among All Treated Subjects With and Without Retreatment
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of Radiesse for hand treatment as measured by live, subject-completed Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS) scores between baseline and 3, 6, 9, and 12 months, by subject, among treated subjects with and without retreatment

arm_group.description: Device: Radiesse Dermal Filler mixed with 2% lidocaine-HCl (final concentration: 0.3% lidocaine-HCl)
Untreated controls crossed over to treatment with Radiesse Dermal Filler mixed with 2% lidocaine-HCl (final concentration: 0.3% lidocaine) at 3 months

intervention.description: Calcium hydroxylapatite particles suspended in an aqueous based gel carrier.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Has right and left hands with rating of 2 or 3 on the Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS) as determined by a live, masked evaluator
- Is at least 18 years of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has history of hypertropic scarring
- Has a known bleeding disorder or receiving medication that will increase the risk of bleeding as the result of injection
- Has a known hypersensitivity to any of the components of Radiesse or local anesthesia
- Has received in past 6 months or plans to receive during the study dermal resurfacing procedure (chemical peel, dermabrasion, ablative laser resurfacing) or non-invasive skin tightening (Thermage®) in the dorsum of the hands
- Has received in past 2 weeks or plans to receive during the study prescription wrinkle therapies, topical steroids, skin irritating topical preparations, or pigmenting agents (self-tanning agents) in the dorsum of the hands
- Has had any dermal fillers or surgery in the dorsum of the hand

group.title: Radiesse® Injectable Dermal Filler
group.description: Device: Radiesse Dermal Filler mixed with 2% lidocaine-HCl (final concentration: 0.3% lidocaine-HCl) Radiesse Injectable Dermal Filler: Calcium hydroxylapatite particles suspended in an aqueous-based gel carrier

group.title: Delayed Treatment
group.description: Untreated controls crossed over to treatment with Radiesse Dermal Filler mixed with 2% lidocaine-HCl (final concentration: 0.3% lidocaine) at 3 months Radiesse Injectable Dermal Filler: Calcium hydroxylapatite particles suspended in an aqueous-based gel carrier

baseline.population: 113 of 114 subjects (99%) completed the main study through 3 months. One subject randomized to the control group suffered a non-study related broken hand after enrollment but prior to 3 month follow up and treatment. This subject’s effectiveness data were imputed as “No change” for the purposes of the primary effectiveness analysis.

group.title: Radiesse® Injectable Dermal Filler
group.description: Device: Radiesse Dermal Filler mixed with 2% lidocaine-HCl (final concentration: 0.3% lidocaine-HCl) Radiesse Injectable Dermal Filler: Calcium hydroxylapatite particles suspended in an aqueous-based gel carrier

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Fitzpatrick Skin Type
measure.description: The Fitzpatrick Skin Types (FST) represent a standard classification of skin color based on one's response to sun exposure (i.e., burns or tans), rather than defined by race or ethnicity. All FST were eligible for participation in the current study. See full FST descriptions in Astner S, Anderson RR. Skin phototypes 2003. J Invest Dermatol. 2004 Feb;122(2):xxx-xxxi.

class.title: II: burns easily, tans minimally with difficulty
III: burns moderately, tans moderately & uniformly
IV: burns minimally, tans moderately & easily

outcome.title: Mean Change on Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS), by Hand
outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of Radiesse for hand treatment as measured by a mean change on the 5-point Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS) between baseline and 3 months, by hand, among treated subjects and untreated controls. A measure of successful or improved treatment effect is demonstrated by a decrease in MHGS score. MHGS categories are as follows: 0 = no loss of fatty tissue; 1 = mild loss of fatty tissue; slight visibility of veins; 3 = moderate loss of fatty tissue; mild visibility of veins and tendons; 4 = severe loss of fatty tissue; moderate visibility of veins and tendons; and 5 = very severe loss of fatty tissue; marked visibility of veins and tendons.
outcome.population: All primary effectiveness analyses were performed based on the intent-to-treat (ITT) population. This population includes all subjects randomized. One subject was randomized but did not receive treatment and was imputed as “No change” for the primary endpoint.

measure.description: To evaluate the efficacy of Radiesse for hand treatment by evaluating subject-reported, live Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS) ratings at 3 months when compared to baseline among the original treatment group only
measure.population: Single withdrawn subject imputed as "no change"

outcome.title: Mean Change on the Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS), by Hand, Among All Treated Subjects Without Retreatment
outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of Radiesse for hand treatment as measured by mean change on the 5-point Merz Hand Grading Scale (MHGS) between baseline and 3, 6, 9, and 12 months, by hand, among all treated subjects without retreatment. A measure of successful or improved treatment effect is demonstrated by a decrease in MHGS score. MHGS categories are as follows: 0 = no loss of fatty tissue; 1 = mild loss of fatty tissue; slight visibility of veins; 3 = moderate loss of fatty tissue; mild visibility of veins and tendons; 4 = severe loss of fatty tissue; moderate visibility of veins and tendons; and 5 = very severe loss of fatty tissue; marked visibility of veins and tendons.
outcome.population: Single withdrawn subject did not receive treatment and is not included in this analysis.

group.title: Baseline: Radiesse® Injectable Dermal Filler
group.description: Device: Radiesse Dermal Filler mixed with 2% lidocaine-HCl (final concentration: 0.3% lidocaine-HCl) Radiesse® Injectable Dermal Filler: Calcium hydroxylapatite particles suspended in an aqueous based gel carrier.

group.title: 3 Months Post-treatment: Radiesse® Injectable Dermal Filler
group.description: Device: Radiesse Dermal Filler mixed with 2% lidocaine-HCl (final concentration: 0.3% lidocaine-HCl) Radiesse® Injectable Dermal Filler: Calcium hydroxylapatite particles suspended in an aqueous based gel carrier.

reported_events.desc: 113 of 114 subjects (99%) completed the main study through 3 months. One subject randomized to the control group suffered a non-study related broken hand after enrollment but prior to 3 month follow up and treatment. This subject’s effectiveness data were imputed as “No change” for the purposes of the primary effectiveness analysis.

group.title: Radiesse® Injectable Dermal Filler
group.description: Device: Radiesse Dermal Filler mixed with 2% lidocaine-HCl (final concentration: 0.3% lidocaine-HCl) Radiesse Injectable Dermal Filler: Calcium hydroxylapatite particles suspended in an aqueous-based gel carrier

event.sub_title: Other, not within pre-defined (expected) AE categories

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
